file_content.text: You were right. The Revanites rely too heavily on their commanders for direction.
Ah, how wonderful to hear. I so hope the Republic will celebrate victory with us before the knives must be unsheathed.
You are too kind to my humble self. We forget sometimes that unity, not obedience, is the true strength of our Empire.
We embark soon. My soldiers rest and luxuriate while they can.
My sisters, my sons... we drink together, to celebrate this mission as we have so many others. To share in our purpose.
To you, Lord Ray'en! To the Empire!
Indeed. Yet the Revanites have no guiding purpose or ideals, as we do. Their minds are weak, molded by the cultists above them in the hierarchy.
Remove the commanders, and the rank-and-file will thrash like a worm out of dirt. Do so in strength and do so in joy.
Celebrate our victory today--for tomorrow, we may give our life to achieve it.
